conclusion: To find the magnitude of the pressure exerted by the sled on the ground, we need to consider the forces acting on the sled and the ground.
The forces acting on the sled are the force of the adult pulling the sled and the force of the sled's weight.
The force exerted by the adult is given as 100 N, and the angle of the force is 37° above the horizontal.
The horizontal component of the force is calculated as 100 × cos(37°) = 100 × 0.8 = 80 N.
The vertical component of the force is calculated as 100 × sin(37°) = 100 × 0.6 = 60 N.
The weight of the sled is calculated as 10 kg × 10 m/s² = 100 N.
The net force on the sled is calculated as 80 N (horizontal component) + 60 N (vertical component) + 100 N (sled's weight) = 240 N.
The net torque on the sled is calculated as 240 N × 37° = 9120 N·m.
The pressure exerted by the sled on the ground is defined as the force of the sled's weight divided by the area of contact between the sled and the ground.
The area of contact is calculated as the horizontal component × vertical component = 80 N × 60 N = 4800 m².
The pressure is calculated as 9120 N·m / 4800 m² = 19.2 N/m².
The magnitude of the pressure exerted by the sled on the ground is 19.2 N/m².
